column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=As you campaign around your riding , it 's likely that some issues are mentioned more often by voters , than other issues .
#Text=What would you say are the three hottest topics this election , in your riding ?
#Text=What would you and your party do to address these issues ?
#Text=People in St Paul 's seem to be most concerned about the economy ( and pensions ) , health care and the environment .
#Text=The economy would benefit from lower taxes , less government spending and meddling .
#Text=Entrepreneurship could flourish and the economy grow .
#Text=The political decision-making process cannot effectively be used to manage an economy .

#Text=Libertarians would cease the pandering for votes , stop all corporate welfare , allow researchers and new business creators to benefit from their achievements ( eliminating capital gains and dividend taxation among other things ) , dramatically simplify regulations , eliminate the restrictions on foreign investment in Canada , eliminate marketing boards , cut the civil service bureaucracy , etc. etc. , etc.
#Text=Short term , the concentration would be waste , dysfunctional and inappropriate programme spending and efficiency ( easy targets in this environment ) .
#Text=Longer term a broader and deeper elimination of programmes and an opening up of the market place to more options , competitors and innovators .
#Text=Health care , in particular will benefit from new options , competition and an arena for open innovation .
#Text=There is no moral , ethical , economic or technical justification for continuing to criminalize the open provision of health care options .

#Text=Too many of our vulnerable parents , children , spouses , friends and neighbours are at risk to ignore the quality of care any longer simply to ensure that all Canadians have access to the same ( poor ) execution .
#Text=The environment is somewhat different .

#Text=Where pollution and other environmental degradation is at issue we consider the problem in two aspects : ( i ) government controlled environment ( crown lands , waterways , underground mineral rights , airspace , 200-mile-limit ocean waters off our coastline , etc. ) and ( ii ) private property .
#Text=With respect to ( i )
#Text=Canadians and all other statist countries suffer the typical ( and inevitable ) " tragedy of the commons . "
#Text=( When everybody owns it nobody owns it and it is treated accordingly .

#Text=If and when legislation is passed to control it , the regulations are politically designed , favour special interest groups for political gain and the associated shenanigans produce an even worse outcome than existed prior to action being taken . )
#Text=Hence clear-cutting , hence goldmine tailings in beautiful rivers , hence irrigation scemes [ sic ] despoiling wetlands , etc. , etc. !
#Text=Real owners care AND are interested in the long term to cover their children 's children or their corporation 's future growth and success !
#Text=Libertarians would sell these assets and create an ownership environment that would foster environmentalism , conservation and rational exploitation and / or enjoyment of natural resources .
#Text=With respect to ( ii ) our laws are adequate ( or should be and certainly can be made to be ) to protect private property from polluters and despoilers , whether individuals or corporations .
#Text=Unfortunately they currently are not adequate to protect us from our own government 's encroachment , its ' pandering of rent seekers , or its ' political decision making .
#Text=Hence pig farms in your back yard , hence mineshafts sunk in your back forty , hence a high rise or monster home erected across the street , etc. , etc. !
